content: Which of the following is a primary objective of risk exposure analysis?

choices.D: Assessing whether the identified risks should be accepted or mitigated
choices.A: Collecting information that can be used for future risk analysis
choices.C: Estimating the impact of the risk on the project and the product

content: Actions in the risk management continuous process consist of:

choices.C: Accepting, mitigating, or transferring the risk
choices.D: Assigning work and following up to make sure its completed
choices.A: Accepting or rejecting the primary risk
choices.B: Contingency planning for the primary risk

content: Cost variance is computed as the difference between:

choices.C: ACWP and BCWS
choices.D: BCWS and BCWP

content: The use of program evaluation and review technique (PERT) requires:

choices.D: Less data than a Gantt chart
choices.A: The critical path to be known in advance
choices.B: Slack times to be added to the critical path
choices.C: Time estimates for each activity in the network

content: Work breakdown structure means

choices.C: The project plan received the support of upper management
choices.D: The statement of work is divided into a detailed listing of activities
choices.A: All potential development activities have been crashed
choices.B: That either a PERT or CPM chart has been developed and used

content: The concept of software security is based principally on:

choices.B: The time and resources required to compromise an asset
choices.C: Applying tools to avoid the risk of compromise
choices.D: Having a security department staffed with competent people

content: Software defense is based on the principle of:

choices.B: Identifying, isolating, dividing, and conquering threats
choices.C: Avoiding, detecting, masking, and catching threats
choices.D: Mixing different functions across the environment
choices.A: Reducing the possibility of compromise to zero

content: Which of the following is the critical path in the activity network above?

choices.C: A, B, D, E, F, H, I, J
choices.D: A, K, L, M, J
choices.A: A, B, C, F, G, I, J
choices.B: A, B, D, E, F, G, I, J

content: In a project network, if the earliest an event can take place is week 45, the most likely time it will take place is week 49, and the latest it can take place, without delaying the project completion, is week 51, what is the event slack time?

choices.C: 6 weeks
choices.D: Cannot be determined from the given information

content: One advantage of Gantt chart usage is:

choices.A: The charts are easy to understand
choices.B: The details of activities are easily displayed
choices.C: Each bar represents several activities
choices.D: Estimates of optimistic, most likely, and pessimistic times are

content: Four software engineers are capable of individually producing 5,000 LOG/year. When assigned as members of a project their combined productivity is 18,500 LOO/year. What is the reason for this anomaly?

choices.C: Complex communication paths
choices.D: Poor project management

content: Layering multiple security functions in order to improve the risk level is called:

choices.C: Distracting the hacker
choices.D: Defense in depth

content: A security penetration of a targeted system is most likely if:

choices.C: The system is connected to the internet
choices.D: Escalation is successful

content: Risk analysis planning should:

choices.C: Identify and implement a metrics program
choices.D: Be reviewed only at the end of a project
choices.A: Start at the risk handling phase

content:
A software project is 8 weeks into development. The following cost information is available:
Planned Value $12,000
Earned Value $16,000
Actual Cost $15,000
What is the cost variance of the project?
A burn-down chart shows:

choices.C: The work remaining in a Sprint
choices.D: The scheduled work for a release

content: Estimating software size, based on process and problem knowledge, is known as:

choices.C: Similar project estimating
choices.D: Decomposition techniques

content: What process describes action items that are assigned, reviewed, and tracked to closure?

choices.C: Closed loop
choices.D: Open loop

content:
A PERT diagram was drawn showing the fifteen activities required for the implementation of a new computer system for a particular firm. With major activities identified by letters, the five paths through the network and their lengths were:
Path 1 A-C-G-M 10 weeks
2: B-D-F-N 15 weeks
3: A-H-I-J-K-O 12 weeks
4: A-Ed-L-N 10 weeks
5: A-C-K-L-M 13 weeks
The critical path(s) is/are:

choices.C: Path 3
choices.D: Path 5

content: Which of the following approaches would reduce the length of a total project schedule?

choices.A: An overlap of activities that are on the critical path
choices.B: An overlap of activities that are not on the critical path
choices.C: A decrease in the duration of activities that are on the critical path
choices.D: A decrease in the duration of activities that are not on the critical path

content: Which of the following sets of components is critical to an internal problem-tracking system?

choices.B: Tester name, test case identification, log number
choices.C: Date, source of the problem, original developer's name
choices.D: Frequency, repair comments, maintenance schedule

content:
Determine the schedule variance from the information below:
Hours expended = 138
complete = 40
project time elapsed = 40
Total hours budgeted = 400

choices.C: +22 hours
choices.D: +55.2 hours
